      • setPassword

        public void setPassword​(Identity ident,
                        java.lang.String password,
                        PasswordPolice.Expiry expires,
                        boolean isSystemAdmin,
                        boolean isPasswordAdmin)
                 throws GeneralException
        Set the password after checking policies. This is what most of the UI beans should call to change a password. NOTE: Password will be encrypted before it is set on the Identity object
        Parameters:
        ident - Identity to set password on
        password - used to set password on the Identity
        expires - flag indicates whether this is a generated password that may have a different expiration period.
        isSystemAdmin - is the current user logged in a system admin
        isPasswordAdmin - is the current user logged in a password admin
        Throws:
        GeneralException - If something goes sideways

      • setPasswordNoCheck

        public void setPasswordNoCheck​(Identity ident,
                               java.lang.String password,
                               PasswordPolice.Expiry expires,
                               boolean isPasswordAdmin)
                        throws GeneralException
        Set the password without checking policies. This is public so it can be called from the IIQEvalator to set the password after it has gone through validation and approval.
        Parameters:
        ident - Identity to set password on
        password - used to set password on the Identity
        expires - flag indicates whether this is a generated password that may have a different expiration period.
        isPasswordAdmin - is the current user logged in a password admin
        Throws:
        GeneralException - If something goes sideways

      • setPassword

        public void setPassword​(Identity ident,
                        java.lang.String password,
                        java.lang.String currentPassword,
                        PasswordPolice.Expiry expires,
                        boolean isSystemAdmin,
                        boolean isPasswordAdmin)
                 throws GeneralException
        Set the password after checking policies. This method also verifies that the old password is entered correctly This is what most of the UI beans should call to change a password.
        Parameters:
        ident - Identity to set password on
        password - used to set password on the Identity
        currentPassword - the current password of the identity
        expires - flag indicates whether this is a generated password that may have a different expiration period.
        isSystemAdmin - is the current user logged in a system admin
        isPasswordAdmin - is the current user logged in a password admin
        Throws:
        GeneralException - If something goes sideways

                                 GeneralException

        Parameters:
        identity - Identity used to check the current password
        currentPassword - current password of the identity
        Throws:
        sailpoint.api.PasswordPolicyException - If something goes sideways
        GeneralException - If something goes sideways

        Parameters:

                                   java.lang.String confirmation,

                            throws sailpoint.api.PasswordPolicyException

        confirmation - confirmed password
        requireCurrentPassword - true if current password is required
        currentPassword - current password

      • findInvalidHashingPolicies

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> findInvalidHashingPolicies()
                                                            throws GeneralException
        Finds any configured password policies, including the IIQ policy, that contain constraints that are not allowed if hashing is enabled.
        Returns:
        The list of invalid policy names.
        Throws:
        GeneralException - If something goes sideways

      • checkPassword

        public void checkPassword​(Identity identity,
                          java.lang.String password,
                          boolean isSystemAdmin)
                   throws GeneralException,
                          sailpoint.api.PasswordPolicyException
        Check password policy for an Identity. Throw an exception if a violation is found. Identity is passed in in case we want to provide identity-specific policies such as password history.
        Parameters:
        identity - Identity to check the password policy on
        password - password to check
        isSystemAdmin - is the current user logged in a system admin
        Throws:
        GeneralException - If something goes sideways
        sailpoint.api.PasswordPolicyException - If something goes sideways

                          java.lang.String password)
                   throws GeneralException,
                          sailpoint.api.PasswordPolicyException
        Check validity of password against identity's password policy.
        Parameters:
        link - Account on application correlated to the identity.
        password - password to check
        Throws:
        GeneralException
        sailpoint.api.PasswordPolicyException

                                     boolean ignoreHistory)
                              throws GeneralException,
                                     sailpoint.api.PasswordPolicyException
        Check validity of password against identity's password policy.
        Parameters:

        password - password to check
        ignoreHistory - Whether to check the password history or not
        Throws:

                          sailpoint.api.PasswordPolicyException

        Parameters:

        password - The password to check
        passwordHistory - The password history

      • addPasswordHistory

        public void addPasswordHistory​(Identity identity,
                               java.lang.String password)
                        throws GeneralException
        Called by the UI to save an entry on the password history list. It is assumed that policies have already been checked. The transaction is NOT committed.
        Parameters:
        identity - to add password history to
        password - to add to password history
        Throws:
        GeneralException - If something goes sideways

      • getIIQPasswordConstraints

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getIIQPasswordConstraints​(java.util.Locale locale,
                                                                  java.util.TimeZone timeZone)
                                                           throws GeneralException
        Get the list of password constraints used by IIQ. If no policy then contains single string No constraints defined
        Parameters:
        locale - Locale to localize to
        timeZone - Timezone to localize to
        Returns:
        Localized password policy
        Throws:
        GeneralException - If something goes sideways

      • getIIQPasswordConstraints

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getIIQPasswordConstraints​(java.util.Locale locale,
                                                                  java.util.TimeZone timeZone,
                                                                  boolean showNoConstraintMessage)
                                                           throws GeneralException
        Get the list of password constraints used by IIQ
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale to localize to
        timeZone - The timezone to localize to
        showNoConstraintMessage - Whether to include the No constraints message
        Returns:
        Localized password policy or empty list if no policy defined
        Throws:
        GeneralException - If something goes sideways

      • setPasswordExpiration

        public void setPasswordExpiration​(Identity identity,
                                  PasswordPolice.Expiry expires)
                           throws GeneralException
        Called when the password has been changed, calculating the expiration date. The transaction is NOT committed.
        Parameters:
        identity - identity to set password expiration
        expires - flag may indicate that we're giving the identity a system generated password that is expected to be changed sooner than a normal password.
        Throws:
        GeneralException - If something goes sideways

      • checkExpiration

        public void checkExpiration​(Identity identity)
                     throws ExpiredPasswordException,
                            GeneralException
        Check to see if the password for an identity has expired. I originally had this in Authenticator but it seems close enough to password policy to do it here. !! If there is a expiration date but it is beyond the number of days currently configured should we reduce it? Also if expiration days is set back to zero should this effetively disable password expiration immediately or do we still obey the previously calculated expirations?
        Throws:
        GeneralException - If something goes sideways
        ExpiredPasswordException - If something goes sideways

      • validatePasswordPolicy

        public boolean validatePasswordPolicy​(Configuration config,
                                      sailpoint.api.MessageAccumulator msgs)
        Look for conflicts among the password configuration properties. The Configuration object we're given is typically being edited in the UI and not yet persisted. Since we can in theory find more than one thing wrong, we'll leave error messages in an accumulator rather than throwing exceptions. The method returns false if any conflicts were found.
        Parameters:
        config - system configuration
        msgs - message accumulator to keep error messages
        Returns:
        True if password policy is valid

      • validate

        public void validate()
              throws GeneralException
        Iterate through PasswordConstraint objects and validate password with password policy
        Throws:
        GeneralException - If something goes sideways
